p: The EO of Dennettia tripetala G. Baker (Annonaceae) demonstrated significant analgesic, anti-inflammatory, hypothermic, sedative, muscle relaxant, and central nervous system depressant activities [ 115]. The EO of D. tripetala contains several compounds including 1-nitro-2-phenylethane (80%), β-eudesmol andnerolidol (4%), 1-linalool (11%), β-caryophyllene, and β-humuline. The compound 1-Nitro-2-phenylethane obtained from the oil of D. tripetala exhibited dose-dependent hypnotic, anticonvulsant and anxiolytic effects, and is the compound largely responsible for the neuropharmacological effects of the oil [ 66].
